page.title: 05An Ancient Way in Kettlesing
page.content: The main road through the block is the A59, Harrogate-Skipton road, run- ning East-West along the southern edge of the block, at an altitude of approx. 200 metres. It follows the line of the old Roman road known locally as "Watling Street," an off- shoot of the Aldborough-Ribchester routeway, and probably used mainly as a "salt road" in Medieval times - Saltergate Hill lies a mile outside our block on the A59. Although in a rural area, the road carries a large volume of commercial traffic. Accidents occur too frequent- ly, caused mainly by the long, fast A59 cut regularly by N/S intersections combined with extreme weather conditions.
